sect1.title: From Spec Files (RPM)
sect1.para: To create an RPM package, you need:

listitem.para: the spec file which is the build recipe
a file with the extension .changes that can be used to document the package history
optional patches which changes the original source code to fix problems in regards to security, the build process, or other issues
other files which do not fall into one of the previous categories

sect1.title: As &obs.ai;

listitem.para: an appimage.yml file which acts as a build recipe.
everything else you need to build a RPM package (see ).
an optional _service file if you integrate the source code from a version control system.

sect1.para: There are three ways to build an &obs.ai;:

listitem.para: a combination of the previous two methods.

sect1.para: To build a new &obs.ai; from RPM packages, proceed as follows:

step.para: Build RPM packages as described in . Make sure the packages have been built successfully.
Prepare your project to support &obs.ai;. In this example, we use the home project &obshome1;:
To open the meta configuration, run:

toms 2017-09-05: Maybe this step should be explained in a separate section/procedure? To use the Web interface of your &obsa; instance to do the same, go to your home project and click Advanced Meta .
To enable &obs.ai; support, add the following XML snippet into the editor:
The OBS:AppImage project is specific to &osbs;.
Adapt the PROJECT placeholder and the architecture.
Save the configuration.
Create a appimage.yml with the following content:

example.title: &obs.ai; from RPM Files (appimage.yml)
example.screen:
app: APPNAME
build: packages: - linuxdeployqt
ingredients: packages: - MY_RPM_PACKAGE
script: # instructions

callout.para: toms 2017-09-05: any restrictions in naming? Contains the name of &obs.ai; application. You can use any name you want, but we recommend using lowercase names.
Defines the build requirements using RPM package names.

para.remark: toms 2017-09-07: is this package always needed? What's it's purpose?

callout.para: Defines the installation requirements for the &obs.ai;. These packages are installed into the &obs.ai; build root environment.
Contains installation instructions. toms 2017-09-04: FIXME: add more information

step.para: Build the &obs.ai;:
Retrieve the new &obs.ai; from the /var/tmp/build-root/AppImage-x86_64/usr/src/packages/OTHER/ directory under der name APPNAME-VERSION-LIBRARY-ARCH.AppImage.

sect1.para: To build &obs.ai;s from source, change the appimage.yml file as follows:

example.title: &obs.ai; from Source File (appimage.yml)
example.screen:
app: APPNAME
build: packages: - linuxdeployqt - cmake git: - &gitupstream1;.git
script: - cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=/usr . - make - make install DESTDIR=/usr # other lines suppressed
